item.title: Sarah Mullally named first woman Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: Sarah Mullally has been named as the new Archbishop of Canterbury, becoming the first woman to be chosen to lead the world's 85 million Anglicans.

item.title: UK police release names of the 2 victims of the Manchester synagogue attack
item.description: Greater Manchester Police named Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66 as the victims of Thursday's attack. Three more remain hospitalized in serio...

item.title: What to know about former U.K. leader Tony Blair, tapped by Trump for postwar Gaza role
item.description: As Britain's prime minister, Tony Blair succeeded in negotiating peace in Northern Ireland in 1998. Five years later, he joined the U.S.-led invasion ...
